title: Donny Osmond, NCIS Are Ratings Winners
description: Not even a victory by the ever-wholesome Donny Osmond, above, on Dancing With the Stars on Tuesday was enough to propel that ABC show past CBSs powerhouse lineup of NCIS shows. According to Nielsens estimates, the two-hour Dancing finale on ABC drew 19.2 million viewers, but CBS won the night overall with NCIS (20.3 million), NCIS: Los Angeles (17.2 million) and The Good Wife (12.5 million). NBC ranked third with The Biggest Loser (8.9 million), followed by The Jay Leno Show (4.9 million). Fox was fourth with So You Think You Can Dance (5.4 million).

title: The Vision to Depict It Their Way
description: SAN FRANCISCO

title: Talent Beloved and Hairdos Admired
description: BETH DITTO is all for some spectacle. As the powerful lead singer of Gossip, a postpunk band from Portland, Ore., she is pure strutting charisma onstage, an energetic, sweaty, often undressed star. Though the band started out in 1999 as part of the hardscrabble underground scene in Olympia, Wash., the groups latest album, Music for Men (Columbia), adds a disco-pop spin to its once spare sound, with Hannah Blilie on drums and Nathan Howdeshell on guitar; its now on a world tour. The outspoken Ms. Ditto, a 28-year-old reared in Arkansas, has also carved out a niche as perhaps rocks only out lesbian who is both an advocate for fat acceptance and a glam fashion darling. Before a recent show in Los Angeles  a city she admitted she didnt much care for, except for the shopping  she spoke by phone with Melena Ryzik about style, longevity and a list of current bands, with excerpts below. She chose these groups, she said, partly because they are thoughtful and really fun live. My favorite thing, she said, is sad songs with happy beats.

title: Swan Song of Offenbach, the Outsider
description: NO offense, but its a little like Frankenstein, the director Bartlett Sher genially told the bass-baritone Alan Held during a recent rehearsal of Offenbachs Contes dHoffmann (Tales of Hoffmann) at the Metropolitan Opera. Mr. Sher, referring to the menacing laugh that announces Dr. Miracles appearance in the second act, suggested that Mr. Held, who is singing the four villains, try a subtler approach.

title: Mumbai Still Vulnerable on Anniversary of Attacks
description: A year after the deadly assault that killed 163 people, Mumbai is a more cautious and safer place, but remains vulnerable.

title: Guests? Just Roll Out the Air
description: The Process

title: American Designers, Dreaming in Ice
description: THE Americans Dennis Rolland, an interior designer, and Andre Landeros Michel, a creative director, will be among the 20 teams of artists and designers from around the world who will each be creating rooms for this years Icehotel, a seasonal hotel in Swedish Lapland (connected to a regular, heated one) in which everything, including the furnishings, is constructed of ice. To reporters of a certain age, this raises one crucial question: Where is the bathroom?

title: Young Designer on a Roll
description: Mimi Tin, a graphic and branding designer in Atlanta, has created a line of sushi furniture, and since it is not often that one has the opportunity to put ones feet up on a California roll, we were delighted to have her drop by when she was in New York recently.

title: Glass Sculpture to Look at and See By
description: Jeff Zimmerman, whose show, Drawings in Glass, opened recently at R 20th Century in TriBeCa, is an artist, designer and craftsman  it makes his work a unique brand of modern craft, said Evan Snyderman, who owns the gallery with Zesty Meyers.

title: View the Apartment, Buy the Chair
description: Three model apartments at One Jackson Square, a new building by Kohn Pedersen Fox Associates, were decorated by the New York interior designers Steven Gambrel, Julie Hillman and David Mann. Unlike most model apartments, the units are outfitted with furnishings that are for sale, many of them on 1stdibs, the vintage and antiques Web site.

title: Martha Stewarts Employees to You
description: This year, for the first time, Martha Stewart Living Omnimedias annual employee holiday sale  where craftspeople and artisans who work for the company sell their wares  will be open to the public, on Dec. 5. Items available include wood-grain porcelain dinner plates ($38 each) and small plates ($25 each), left, by Marcie McGoldrick, the editorial director for crafts and holiday; and screen-printed cotton napkins ($24 a pair) by Stefanie Lynen, a designer at Martha Stewart Crafts. Noon to 6 p.m., at 601 West 26th Street (12th Avenue); marthastewart.com/craft-sale.

title: Cut-Rate Cutlery, Lighting for Less
description: Ikea will offer discounts on a range of items at a sale Nov. 27 (flatware for four, below, regularly about $40, will be about $10); for information and locations: info.ikea-usa.com/seizethedays.

title: Hershey Could Finance Purchase of Cadbury, but Shouldnt
description: Hershey could just about scrape together the $17 billion it would need to trump Krafts bid for Cadbury, the British confectioner. Hershey could even do it without having the charitable trust set up by its founder lose control, according to calculations by Breakingviews.com. But investors would be unwise to entrust the candy concern with more of their cash without lots of sweeteners.

title: Additional Names of Visitors Are Released by White House
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration on Wednesday released a second installment from its logs of White House visitors in the first seven months of Mr. Obamas term, revealing a roster of business executives, Democratic strategists and lobbyists showing up for meetings, events or tours.

title: Excerpt: 'Scrubs'
description: ABC is bringing back the hospital comedy but relocating it to a medical school, with some original cast members returning as professors.

title: VW Merger Will Cut Porsche Debt
description: Porsches $17.2 billion of debt will be mostly eliminated after the sports-car maker completes its merger with Volkswagen, Martin Winterkorn, chief executive of both companies, said Friday.

title: Holiday Gifts With a Story to Tell
description: SHOPPERS, be advised: The human touch rules this year. Also anything even vaguely critter-like, be it mammalian, reptilian or insectival. Decay, as opposed to the merely antique, is also rampant, imbued with attitude or lush with metaphor.

title: What's Cooking on Thanksgiving
description: The terms cooks enter into search engines can provide clues as to what dishes are being cooked around the nation.

title: Referees Role in Scandal Under Scrutiny in Europe
description: The governing body of European soccer, known by the acronym UEFA, said Wednesday that it was investigating the possible involvement of three referees and one other official connected to UEFA, in what the organization called the biggest match-fixing scandal in Europe.

title: Escape From New York
description: The rush to return home on the day before Thanksgiving resulted in packed transportation hubs in New York.

title: Obama Backs Senate on Health Bills Disparities
description: WASHINGTON  Two of President Obamas senior health care advisers said Wednesday that a proposed tax on high-cost insurance plans and a new commission to control Medicare spending were among four pillars essential to major health care legislation.

title: The Zoo That Is Grand Central, at Full Gallop
description: The packed train raced toward its final stop in Midtown, a thousand weary commuters aboard. Thirty seconds down the track, a train running in the opposite direction seemed to be heading straight toward it.

title: Two Swiss Telecom Companies to Merge
description: France Tlcom said Wednesday that it would pay 1.5 billion euros ($2.27 billion) to merge its Swiss subsidiary with Sunrise, Switzerlands No. 2 operator, in an effort to challenge the state-owned market leader, Swisscom.

title: In Kentucky, a Senate Candidate With a Pedigree for Agitation
description: FRANKFORT, Ky.  Representative Ron Paul proved to be a surprising presence in the presidential race in 2008. Now his son, Dr. Rand Paul, has become an unexpected contender in the 2010 Senate race in Kentucky.

title: A Stylist, Inside the Ring and Out
description: At a reading for a new book on Sugar Ray Robinson, friends and fans of the legendary boxer discuss his importance to Harlem.

title: Sugar Rays Harlem, Back in the Day
description: When Sugar Ray Robinson ruled the ring as a champion welterweight and middleweight in the 1940s and 50s, the most important member of his team of corner men was neither his trainer nor his cut man.

title: Miami-Dade Hopes Online Auctions Will Help Reduce Backlog of Foreclosures
description: MIAMI  Buying into Miamis foreclosure glut will soon be a whole lot easier.

title: Retailers Extend Deals Beyond Black Friday
description: Attention shoppers: It might pay to just sleep in this Black Friday.

title: Businesses in U.S. Brace for New Rules on Emissions
description: The nations corporations have long been bracing for the day when they would be required to carry out sharp cuts in the emissions that cause global warming. That day seemed to move a bit closer on Wednesday, when President Obama outlined a national target for such reductions.

title: Kentuckys Highest Court Halts Executions in State
description: The Supreme Court of Kentucky suspended executions in the state Wednesday, ruling that officials did not follow state law in adopting its procedures for killing inmates.

title: Heritage Turkeys Selling Briskly, Even at $10 a Pound
description: Handmade chocolates, artisanal cheeses, vintage Champagne  consumers are thinking twice about splurging on such luxurious goods during the tough economic times. But sales of at least one fancy food item have held up: gourmet turkeys that easily cost $100 or more.

title: From Yanks Core to Pacquiao, Plenty of Cheers
description: For all the scandals and scoundrels, on Thanksgiving there are always good names to be thankful for:

title: Obama Will Use West Point as Backdrop to Present Afghan Strategy
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama will formally unveil his Afghanistan strategy on Tuesday night in a prime-time televised address before a group of cadets and soldiers at the United States Military Academy at West Point, White House officials said Wednesday.

title: In Currys Latest Setback, Hint of New Resolve
description: LOS ANGELES  Any Eddy Curry aches and pains are met with care, caution and held breaths within the Knicks organization. Too often, Curry has made only guest appearances in Knicks games because of injuries that appear to be mild afflictions but turn out to be more problematic.

title: U.S. Seeks More Allied Troops for Afghanistan
description: WASHINGTON  The United States is scrambling to coax NATO allies to send 10,000 additional troops to Afghanistan as part of President Obamas strategy for the region. Those countries appear willing to provide fewer than half that number, American and allied officials said Wednesday.

title: Jets Kerry Rhodes Says His Demotion Is a Timeout
description: In 10 games this season, safety Kerry Rhodes has recorded an equal number of interceptions, sacks, forced fumbles and fumble recoveries  zero. Because of that, and because the Jets are 4-6, Coach Rex Ryan has demoted Rhodes for their game Sunday against Carolina.

title: The Turkey Day Trot, Explained
description: Every Thanksgiving, I get the urge to chase something. Like a dog after a bird. Or a Neanderthal in search of prey. Its very primitive, I admit, and harder still to say with a straight face. But just before the big feast, I feel the need for biped speed over a moldering carpet of leaves.

title: From Footnote to Fame in Civil Rights History
description: On that supercharged day in 1955, when Rosa Parks refused to give up her bus seat to a white passenger in Montgomery, Ala., she rode her way into history books, credited with helping to ignite the civil rights movement.

title: Soul-Searching in Turkey After a Gay Man Is Killed
description: ISTANBUL  For Ahmet Yildiz, a stocky and affable 26-year-old, the choice to live openly as a gay man proved deadly. Prosecutors say his own father hunted him down, traveling more than 600 miles from his hometown to shoot his son in an old neighborhood of Istanbul.

title: Limelight Lives, Burned by Booze
description: Robert Sellerss Hellraisers is completely unapologetic about its party-hearty premise. He has slapped together a string of outlandish stories about four of the British Isles most stylish drunken actors, and he doesnt even pretend to have turned those stories into a coherent book. Hellraisers wants only to be a rowdy collection of greatest hits, and it lives up to that fun-loving ambition. It reels off riotous tales about Richard Burton, Richard Harris, Peter OToole and Oliver Reed without giving a moments thought to what those tales might mean.

title: Listening In on the Mumbai Attackers Phone Calls
description: As my colleagues Sahar Habib Ghazi and Sabrina Tavernise reported from Pakistan, seven Pakistanis accused of planning last years attacks in Mumbai, India, were formally charged Wednesday, the eve of the first anniversary of the assault.

title: N.F.L.s Moves Signal a Truce on Concussions
description: Andre Waters, a former N.F.L. defensive back, put a pistol in his mouth, pulled the trigger and  however unknowingly  sounded an alarm on the seriousness of football brain injuries.

title: In Welcoming Iranian President, Chavez Blasts Israel
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  President Hugo Chvez rolled out the welcome mat here on Wednesday for President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad of Iran, using the visit to strengthen Venezuelas political alliance with Iran and to lash out at Israel, which Mr. Chvez described as the murderous arm of the Yankee empire.

title: Costumes by Rabanne
description: On fields oer which the reapers hand has passdLit by the harvest moon and autumn sun,My thoughts like stubble floating in the windAnd of such fineness as October airs,There after harvest could I glean my lifeA richer harvest reaping without toil,And weaving gorgeous fancies at my willIn subtler webs than finest summer haze.

title: 2 Journalists Are Freed in Somalia After 15 Months as Captives
description: KHARTOUM, Sudan  After more than a year in captivity at the hands of Somali gunmen, two young Western journalists who were kidnapped in August 2008 were freed on Wednesday, according to Somali officials and the Canadian media.

title: Detentions at Border Are Down
description: Detentions of migrants trying to cross the border illegally dropped to 556,000 in the 2009 fiscal year, a decline of 23 percent over 2008 and the lowest number since the early 1970s, according to official figures released this week.

title: Butterballs or Cheese Balls, an Online Barometer
description: If you are in Oregon this Thanksgiving, you stand a better than average chance of encountering Tofurkey. More people in New York are looking for caterers to prepare the holiday meal than anywhere else in the country. Live in the Southeast? Brace yourself for a big scoop of broccoli casserole.

title: Thompson Is Said to Mull a Run Against Gillibrand
description: ALBANY  City Comptroller William C. Thompson Jr., weighing his options in the wake of a surprisingly close loss in the mayoral race, is seriously considering challenging Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand in next years primary elections, according to people who have spoken to Mr. Thompson and his advisers.

title: Homeless and Begging, Despite Bad Publicity
description: One man walked in silence, making a shame-on-you gesture. Another muttered a skeptical uh, huh beneath his breath. A woman stage-whispered to her friend about the scam that was on TV last night. Two men in suits wanted to inspect the paperwork. One man, clearly agitated, yelled: Didnt you get busted? How do you hold your head up?

title: Bloggingheads: Defending the Filibuster
description: Timothy Noah, left, of Slate and Byron York of The Washington Examiner debate the Senate filibuster.

title: Lottery Numbers
UConn Will Face Duke in the N.I.T. Final
description: For a few fleeting moments in its 81-55 victory over Louisiana State on Wednesday night, Connecticut looked as if it had not skipped a beat since the Final Four.

title: In Debt to Start, and Sinking Even Deeper
description: Theodora Roachs subprime journey started with a knock at the door.

title: A Landlords Foreclosure Puts a Tenant in Trouble
description: Foreclosure has touched Alice Garvins life twice. The first time, four years ago, she came home to find a notice on the front door of the East New York, Brooklyn, apartment building in which she, her sons and two of her grandchildren had lived for two years.

title: Finding a Surprise After Refinancing a Mortgage
description: To Carol Schlossman, Wachovia is a four-letter word.

title: At Obamas First State Dinner, the First Crashers
description: WASHINGTON  This much is known: About 7:15 Tuesday night, a glittering blonde, decked out in a red and gold sari, holding the hand of her black-tuxedoed escort, swept past the camera crews and reporters camped out to catch the red-carpet arrivals for the first state dinner given by President Obama.

title: Corrections
description: National

title: A Truce in the Religious Wars?
description: My Thursday column looks at the literary battles over God in recent years, focusing on recent books such as Karen Armstrongs The Case for God and Robert Wrights The Evolution of God. I found Wrights particularly provocative, although its more popular than scholarly. Then my colleague Nicholas Wades new book, The Faith Instinct, doesnt focus on God so much as on the evolutionary advantages conferred by faith, creating a genetic predisposition to believe in divinity  but its just as fascinating.

title: Corrections
description: An article on Tuesday about a proposed 10-point checklist devised to test Republicans on their commitment to their partys core principles misstated the number of points that candidates would be required to support in order to be endorsed by the Republican National Committee. They would need to agree with at least eight  not seven  of the 10 points.

title: Corrections
description: A chart on Wednesday with an article about President Obamas first state dinner referred imprecisely to the occupation of one of the guests, Jhumpa Lahiri. While she is a Pulitzer Prize-winning writer, she writes fiction; she does not write for the media.

title: A Thanksgiving Toast
description: Sitting down with friends and family today, there will be thanks for the steady currents, flowing out of the past, that have brought us to this table. There will be thanks for the present union and reunion of us all. And there will be prayerful thanks for the future. But its worth raising a glass (or suspending a forkful for those of you whove gotten ahead of the toast) to be thankful for the unexpected, for all the ways that life interrupts and renews itself without warning.

title: Iran Punishes Its People
description: Irans fraudulently elected president, Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, will clearly stop at nothing to stifle legitimate dissent and hold on to his illegitimate power. The most recent horror is the sharp rise in executions since the June presidential elections.

title: New Jerseys Marriage Moment
description: There can come a moment in a politicians career when doing the right thing requires summoning the courage to buck strong voter sentiment. The drama over same-sex marriage in a lame-duck session of the New Jersey State Legislature is not that kind of moment.

title: A Theater Illuminates an Immigration Battlefield
description: Can a play called What Killed Marcelo Lucero? rescue suburban Long Island from its immigration agonies?

title: The Obama Strategy in Afghanistan
description: To the Editor:

title: In Kabul, European Police See Progress
description: To the Editor:

title: Our Health Care Choices, and Our Values
description: To the Editor:

title: A Tale of Two Turkeys
description: On Wednesday, President Obama pardoned his first Thanksgiving turkey.

title: The Religious Wars
description: Just a few years ago, it seemed curious that an omniscient, omnipotent God wouldnt smite tormentors like Richard Dawkins, Christopher Hitchens and Sam Harris. They all published best-selling books excoriating religion and practically inviting lightning bolts.

title: Corrections
description: An article on Nov. 14 about a decision to try five suspects in federal court in New York for the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attacks referred imprecisely to the deaths at the World Trade Center. About 2,750 people died there  not nearly 3,000, the estimated total number of deaths in the attacks that day.

title: South Africa: President Zuma Will Serve as Zimbabwes Mediator
description: President Jacob Zuma has taken over as the regional mediator in Zimbabwes political crisis. His predecessor, Thabo Mbeki, was mistrusted by Zimbabwes prime minister, Morgan Tsvangirai. Mr. Tsvangirai said he believed that Mr. Mbeki was biased in favor of President Robert Mugabe. According to a statement from Mr. Zumas office, he appointed a new Zimbabwe team: Charles Nquakula, his political adviser; Mac Maharaj, his special envoy; and Lindiwe Zulu, his international relations adviser. The team will visit Zimbabwe soon and report back to Mr. Zuma, above.

title: Flu Fears May Curtail Pilgrimage
description: The number of pilgrims to Mecca this year may be down substantially because of fears of swine flu, the BBC and CNN reported Wednesday, citing remarks by government officials. The hajj, an annual pilgrimage, began Wednesday, but an official count of arrivals will not be issued until later. Earlier this year, Saudi Arabia asked pilgrims over 65 or under 12 to stay home, to try to prevent any flu outbreak from overwhelming the hospitals set up for the hajj.

title: Corrections
description: An article on Nov. 18 about Goldman Sachss response to criticism of its high pay and its role in the financial crisis, using information from a Bloomberg News article, quoted imprecisely from remarks by its chief executive, Lloyd C. Blankfein, at a conference in New York. Mr. Blankfein said, We participated in things that were clearly wrong and we have reasons to regret and apologize for. He did not say: We participated in things that were clearly wrong and have reason to regret. We apologize. The imprecise quotation was repeated in an article in Week in Review on Sunday. (The quotation appeared correctly in an editorial on Sunday.)

title: At Valdosta High, Times Change but Expectations Dont
description: VALDOSTA, Ga.  Players still bang their helmets against the corrugated metal roof of the walkway outside the locker room before rushing onto the field here, the collective rumble like a storm coming up from the Gulf. An end-zone billboard continues to welcome visitors to Death Valley, a bold declaration of trouble ahead.

title: Thanksgiving Pulpit Used to Attack Suffrage
description: Friday, Nov. 26, 1909(use this link to access todays entire issue)

title: Corrections
description: An article on Wednesday about a response by the money manager Raj Rajaratnam to charges brought against him by the Securities and Exchange Commission misidentified the federal authority that sought to use wiretaps in an investigation of insider trading at his hedge fund. And the headline also misidentified the authority that Mr. Rajaratnam had accused of illegal wiretaps. In both instances, it was the United States Attorneys office, not the S.E.C.

title: Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, an Associated Press report in the Sports Briefing column on Wednesday about the sale of the Pontiac Silverdome, outside Detroit, misstated the year that Super Bowl XVI was played there. It was 1982, not 1983.

title: Corrections
description: A picture caption on Monday with a dance review of a ballet company at the Joyce Theater misstated part of the companys name. It is Complexions Contemporary Ballet, not Complexions Temporary Ballet.

title: Van Kills Man in Staten Island Hit-and-Run
description: A couple in their 70s were hit by a van in a hit-and-run accident while on their way to Mass on Staten Island on Wednesday night, killing one and seriously injuring the other, the police said.

title: Corrections
description: An article on Nov. 10 about garbage patches in the worlds oceans referred incorrectly to the travels of a graduate student researching a masters thesis on plastic accumulation in the oceans. The student, Bonnie Monteleone, visited the Sargasso Sea, which is part of a feature known as the Atlantic gyre. Thus, it was not the case that she might not have found the gyre. (Ms. Monteleone said instead that she might not have found the zone with the highest concentration of trash.)

title: Corrections
description: A listing in the Calendar on Wednesday about a sake tasting and sushi class scheduled for Monday and Dec. 21 at Sushi Samba misstated the restaurants phone number. It is (212) 691-7885.

title: Corrections
description: A capsule summary on Wednesday for a Books of The Times review of Sweet Thunder, by Wil Haygood, about the flamboyant life of the fighter Sugar Ray Robinson, misidentified the weight class in which Robinson won five titles. He was a middleweight, not a heavyweight. (He won one title as a welterweight.)

title: H. C. Robbins Landon, Haydn and Mozart Scholar, Dies at 83
description: H. C. Robbins Landon, an American musicologist whose research helped to restore many of Haydns works to the active repertory after more than a century of neglect, and whose popular books about Mozart countered many popular myths about that composers life, died on Friday at Rabastens, near Toulouse, France. He was 83.

title: Kings Make the Most of the Knicks Shortcomings
description: SACRAMENTO  The Sacramento Kings Donte Greene matched his career high of 24 points and blocked six shots, and the Knicks were outmuscled inside, outshot outside and outhustled in all points in between during their third consecutive loss.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 918 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans on Tuesday:

title: N.H.L. Scoreboard: Hawks Crush Sharks in Seasons Biggest Game So Far
description: A crowded schedule on Wednesday night, with 28 of the leagues 30 teams in action. But it mostly served as mere prelude to the last game on the slate, the biggest clash of the season so far: the Sharks, No. 1 in the N.H.L., playing host to the red-hot Blackhawks, No. 2 in the league and with $62.8 million signing Marian Hossa in the lineup for the first time.

title: Waldo Hunt, King of the Pop-Up Book, Dies at 88
description: On the flat, foursquare pages of a printed book, Waldo H. Hunt could part the Red Sea. He could make hearts beat, lungs fill and bones rattle. He could make dinosaurs rear up, ships set sail and bats quiver in belfries.

title: South Korea Admits Civilian Killings During War
description: SEOUL, South Korea  In the opening months of the Korean War, the South Korean military and the police executed at least 4,900 civilians who had earlier signed up  often under force  for re-education classes meant to turn them against Communism, the countrys Truth and Reconciliation Commission announced Thursday.

title: Suspect in Philippine Election Killings Surrenders
description: SHARIFF AGUAK, the Philippines  A politician identified as the prime suspect in the massacre of more than 50 people this week who surrendered to the authorities on Thursday is expected to be charged Friday with multiple murders in the worst carnage in the countrys long history of election-related violence.

title: China Joins U.S. in Pledge of Hard Targets on Emissions
description: BEIJING  The Chinese government announced Thursday that it had set a target to slow the growth of its greenhouse gas emissions by 2020, a day after the Obama administration set a provisional target for reducing United States emissions.

title: NIMHOA and NIMROD
description: Two dubious acronyms for advanced NIMBYism  Not In My Home Owners Association and Not In My Range Of Desert.

title: Q. & A. With Simon Kuper, Author of Soccernomics
description: The British author Simon Kuper was born in Uganda in 1969 and grew up in London and Leiden, the Netherlands. He is currently a Paris-based sports columnist for The Financial Times. His book Football Against the Enemy won the William Hill Sports Book of the Year award for 1994. He is also the author of Ajax, the Dutch, the War. His most recent book, Soccernomics: Why England Loses, Why Germany and Brazil Win, and Why the U.S., Japan, Australia, Turkey  Even Iraq  Are Destined to Become the Kings of the Worlds Most Popular Sport, written with the economist Stefan Syzmanski, was published in the United States in early November.

title: Jellyfish and All, a Gem in Romes Chinatown
description: Forget streets brightly lit with quaint lanterns and hordes of tourists, Romes Chinatown is an undefined crisscrossing of roads running from the Termini train station to the Esquiline Hill, ripe with cheap but trendy clothing, jewelry and shoes. Its also where youll find some of the citys more adventurous dining.

title: Seeing Things | Studio Visit With David Wiseman
description: Seeing Things is a biweekly design column by Brooke Hodge, a design writer and curator based in Los Angeles.

title: German General Quits Over Airstrike
description: BERLIN  The chief of staff of the German armed forces resigned Thursday over accusations that the military withheld information on a deadly airstrike in Afghanistan in September that killed civilians as well as insurgents.

title: What Killed F.D.R.?
description: Todays idea: Cancer, not the presumed hypertension, caused the brain hemorrhage that killed President Franklin D. Roosevelt, a new book argues. If widely known at the time, cancer might have prevented F.D.R. from seeking a fourth term, shifting the course of postwar history.History | Writing in Slate, Barron H. Lerner lays out the case set forth in F.D.R.s Deadly Secret, a book due out in January by Steven Lomazow, a neurologist, and Eric Fettman, a journalist. Looking at the presidents secretive medical history, the two theorize that a skin lesion above Roosevelts left eye, which disappeared in photographs after 1940, was in fact a melanoma, the deadliest of skin cancers, and that the disease eventually spread to Roosevelts abdomen and brain:

title: Waiter, Theres Some Grebeshki in My Turtle Soup
description: Hungry for a Tolstoy fix? Richard Pevear and Larissa Volokhonsky, the dynamic duo of Russian translation, are back with a new rendering of The Death of Ivan Ilyich and Other Stories, in bookstores this week.

title: The Leon Lett Thanksgiving Game
description: (Recommended: A funny story from Bill Bates at the end of this video clip)

title: Early Morning Thanksgiving Questions
description: Here we go. Been listening to this for inspiration.

title: How Big Is Too Big?
Could I Be Killing My Guests? (And Other Thanksgiving Queries)
description: If I cook the stuffing inside the turkey, is there a chance I could kill my guests? Im not saying thats necessarily a deal-breaker. Joe Bethersonton, Fargo, N.D.

title: Taillight in the Spotlight
description: Volvos sensuously styled XC60 is a far cry from the companys old boxy station wagons, right down to its writhing, wriggling taillights. With their LEDs positioned in a pattern so the car is easily recognizable from the rear at night, the XC60s taillights shun the straight edges or smooth circles of traditional taillights in favor of a wavy shape  a distinction that is now being honored in a design exhibition at the Serpentine Gallery in London.

title: News Quiz | November 26, 2009
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays front page.

title: Moms the President, and Im Outta Here
description: That was the headline on an article earlier this week on the Web site of the Chronicle of Higher Education. The writer, Emma L. Carew, did such a lovely job unfurling this yarn that Im going to get out of the way and let her tell the first few paragraphs:

title: Europe Reacts to Obamas Copenhagen Trip
description: The reaction in Europe has been mixed to a decision, announced on Wednesday, that President Obama will attend the Copenhagen climate conference as the event gets underway next month.

title: Torn Skin, Not Enough Sweet Potatoes and Other Questions
description: I want to know how the heck to get the butter under the skin of my pastured turkey. That skin is adhered! Janet M., Kansas.

title: Leisurely Read for Thanksgiving, Nov. 26
description: No Speed Read today. Its a holiday. Take your time. Put your feet up. And dont forget to leave room for pie.

title: Do I Need to Panic and Other Questions
description: I have been brining a fresh 14-pound turkey for 12 hours. According to the instructions. I have 2 more hours. Problem is, my fridge is very small, so I put the turkey on the back porch. The temp this morning is 45 degrees, so now I moved everything around in the fridge to make room for the turkey. Well be eating around 4:30. Is the turkey okay to eat or do I need to panic? Karen, Cleveland, Ohio

title: Five Questions for a Rockette
description: Being a Rockette is more than high kicks, ivory smiles and precision spot-turns. There are six-show days, slippery tap shoes and Santas who miss their cues.

title: Sitting Down to Dinner, Afghan-Style
description: As with Thanksgiving dinner in America, the act of sharing a meal is at the core of Afghan hospitality. It is a common trait among the different ethnic groups and factions that make up this war-torn country.

title: Ministry Wont Challenge Polanski Bail Ruling
description: PARIS  Swiss judicial authorities said on Thursday that they would not challenge a court ruling permitting filmmaker Roman Polanski to be freed on bail as he fights extradition to the United States to face sentencing on charges of having sex with a 13-year-old girl.

title: Carving Queries and Other Matters
description: Were trying to make it look easy, sitting back in our Aeron chairs here at Diners Journal HQ and drinking chai, answering your questions as if were the most knowledgeable home cooks in the land. The reality is: every question a tiger, and us mounted high on the elephant, armed with only a switch.

title: Films to Be Projected Around Coit Tower Again
description: A two-day outdoor cinematic event that wraps a San Francisco landmark in projected images of Native Americans began Wednesday and will start again at dusk on Thursday. It will continue until 7 A.M. Friday morning.

title: Early Word: Gobble Gobble
description: President Obama pardoned a turkey named Courage , handed out Thanksgiving groceries to the poor and oversaw major announcements on two of the administrations most significant issues  the war in Afghanistan and climate change  all as Washington hunkered down for the holiday feast.

title: Russia Admits Lapses in Case of Sick Lawyer
description: MOSCOW  A top Russian prison official on Thursday acknowledged wrongdoing in the case of Sergei L. Magnitsky, a 37-year-old lawyer whose death in pretrial detention last week has provoked a groundswell of anger.

title: Glee Watch: True Lies
description: This post contains spoilers.

title: Questions on Sides, Stores and More
description: Lets take a moment here for some inspiration: Bill Monroe playing Southern Flavor on TNNs American Music Shop with Marty Stuart. Thanksgiving! Americas best holiday.

title: Voice of a Fan on Concussions
description: Should Ben Roethlisberger play this Sunday? Should Brian Westbrook play at all this season? Walt Bennett, a frequent Fifth Down commenter, shared his thoughts on being a fan in an age of concussion awareness, and added his view on the minimum the N.F.L. should be doing about it. Take it away, Walt:

title: Package Tour: Driving a FedEx Hybrid
description: THE first thing I noticed when I got behind the wheel of a hybrid FedEx Express delivery truck was the lack of an ignition lock. Instead of using a key, I borrowed one of the radio frequency ID tags that drivers swipe over a reader, and I hit the engine start button to get rolling.

title: Heinz Tallies Cuts in Emissions
description: Two years ago, executives at the Pittsburgh-based food giant Heinz met to hash out sustainability goals that they characterized as aggressive but achievable, according to Michael Mullen, the companys vice president for corporate affairs.

title: Head of Climate Panel Discusses Climate Files
description: Rajendra K. Pachauri, the chairman of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, has distributed a statement on the unauthorized disclosure of thousands of e-mail messages and documents involving a variety of contributors to the panels reports. One e-mail message from July 8, 2004, particularly related to the workings of the climate panel, has been the subject of much discussion.

title: Thursday (Thanksgiving) Reading
description: Several consumer-focused stories appear today in various sections of The New York Times and online. Each weekday morning, we gather them all up here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.

title: Half-Truths Dim Chances for Renewing Mideast Talks
description: JERUSALEM  In recent years, the international community has made one central demand of Israel and one of the Palestinians to create conditions for a two-state solution: Israel must stop building settlements on land the Palestinians want for their state, and the Palestinians must dismantle terrorist networks and end violent attacks on Israelis.

title: Readings and Resources for Planning Your Black Friday
description: While the turkey is in the oven, you may be planning your shopping strategy for Friday. A host of stories in todays New York Times and elsewhere may be of some help.

title: What to Watch on Thursday
description: The Macys Thanksgiving Day Parade was covered live by both NBC (Meredith Vieira, Matt Lauer and Al Roker) and CBS (Maggie Rodriguez and Dave Price) beginning at 9 a.m. NBC then moves to real animals with the National Dog Show (noon) from Oaks, Pa., hosted by John OHurley.

title: Deletionists
description: Wikipedia editors who are quick to delete new or controversial postings.

title: Questions About (Among Other Things) Integrity, Stuffing, Cranberries
description: Dear Sam: Is it possible that by manning the help desk you are cunningly avoiding kitchen duty on Thanksgiving morning? In any case, I have a question. Every year, preparing a meal for 20, we cooked a turkey so large that it monopolized the oven. But we also needed large casseroles of dressing, sweet potatoes and other sides to fit in there. How to solve this dilemma? We decided to move to Berlin, Germany. Whats your solution? Maria, Berlin

title: Broadway Menu to Lose Donuts
description: The Broadway production of Superior Donuts, the bittersweet comedy by Tracy Letts, will close on Jan. 3, the lead producer Jeffrey Richards said on Thursday.

title: Radio, Radio
description: Want some good Thanksgiving advice from The New York Times? Listen to this embedded radio device gizmo!

title: Seeing San Francisco From a Different Angle
description: SAN FRANCISCO  As fires raged downtown after the 1906 earthquake, residents of this city fled to two nearby districts to the south, Bernal Heights and Glen Park. Though part of San Francisco, both areas looked more like countryside then, with open ranchland, vineyards and orchards, dirt roads and wetlands, and a few houses. The windswept peaks above Glen Park were called Little Switzerland.

title: Balcones del Atlntico
description: WHAT Residential beachfront resort.

title: Chief Sponsor Defends G.O.P. Litmus Test
description: In a post on Wednesday, conservative and liberal bloggers alike criticized a proposed resolution that would deny funding and endorsements to Republican candidates who failed to adhere to many core principles. Why, even Ronald Reagan wouldnt pass, some pundits remarked.

title: You Taking Care of Yourself? Getting Some Me Time?
description: We havent talked much about feelings today, about how annoying it is that your sister always has something critical to say, or about how your moms voice gets thick two bourbons into the afternoon and you know that means a fights coming later, or about how unbelievably tired the whole business of putting together a meal for your deadbeat children can make you.

title: Water Funds Proliferate in Latin America
description: Despite an abundance of water in Latin America, 77 million people in the region still lack access to safe drinking supplies, according to the World Water Council  particularly in areas with poor farming practices, unregulated industrialization and urban poverty.

title: From Lancaster to Iraq: A Thanksgiving Day Racing Tradition
description: Among the hundreds of things I miss about home during my year in Iraq is the Turkey Day bike race in Lancaster County, Penn. This unofficial final race of every season draws 50 or more racers from around the county, and it shows which cyclists kept up with their fitness routines since the end of the season in September. So when I finally got a chance to organize a bike race on Tallil Ali Air Base after six months here, I wanted it to be on Thanksgiving Day.

title: U.N. Nuclear Agency Calls Iran Inquiry Dead End
description: The director general of the United Nations nuclear watchdog declared in unusually blunt language on Thursday that Iran had stonewalled investigators about evidence that the country had worked on nuclear weapons design, and that his efforts to reveal the truth had effectively reached a dead end.

title: Iraqi Lawmakers Hunt for Election Compromise
description: BAGHDAD  Iraqs political leaders sought a compromise that would avoid further delay in the countrys national election, officials said on Thursday, warning that fierce disagreements on how to conduct the election could still undo any deal.

title: Filmmaking Workshops at the Museum of the Moving Image
description: The movies are a favorite pastime during the Thanksgiving break, but its a rare cinema that allows children to make films as well as watch them.

title: Inside Art
description: The Inside Art column will return next week.

title: Art in Review
description: COLD WATER

title: The Flexible Nature of Time, and Other Questions
description: Many are writing in now to say that the turkeys almost done and thatd be great if the guests were coming in a half-hour. But theyre not! Theyre coming in two hours, three hours, four. What do to? Is there a way to slow the process? This is a disaster!

title: Movie Listings
description: MOVIES

title: Holiday Shops
description: HOLIDAY SHOPS

title: On the Question of Drinks
description: Id like to have your recommendation for a wine for Thanksgiving turkey dinner. Thank you! Glen Cheney, Macungie, Pa.

title: Three Crooked Gangs, See How They Bumble
description: Simultaneously channeling Scorsese, Jarmusch and Wayans, the first-time feature director Julian Mark Kheel films each story line of his indie comedy The Brooklyn Heist in a different mode. As three bumbling gangs of crooks plan to hit the same pawnshop on the same night, the old friends from the neighborhood are shot Mean Streets style, the buppie gangsters appear in mock rap videos and the solemn Chechnyan siblings perform in art-house black and white.

title: Time to Go Home
description: Weve been at it since early this morning here at the Diners Journal Thanksgiving Help Desk, and its now just about time to close up shop and head over to Emmetts for about five straight vodkas home to the loving family. You can continue to post comments on this or any other post in the series; I hope you do. But questions will now only be answered by your peers. I really do have to knock off, eat, go watch some football. Thanks for reading, and writing. I am very grateful to you all for your time.

title: In a Wifes Crme Brle, Visions of a Stormy Past
description: Almost everybody who arrives at age 50 more or less intact carries memories of an earlier stage of life in which a wilder, unformed self lurched and blundered through young adulthood before making a fateful decision to settle. It could be a career choice or a long-term relationship, or both. For the title character of Rebecca Millers wry, acutely observant drama The Private Lives of Pippa Lee, her comfortable landing is her marriage to a successful book publisher 30 years her senior, whom she describes in a candid running voice-over as her rescuer from a life adrift.

title: Longing for the Old Days and Looking for Meaning
description: Early in Ward No. 6, an updated adaptation of Chekhovs famous short story set in a Russian provincial mental hospital, the chief doctor, Hobotov (Evgeny Stychkin), leads a documentary film crew through the halls of the shabby institution. In a movie that deliberately blurs the line between fiction and reality, present and past, the sane and the crazy, interviews with actual mental patients (one of whom claims to have killed John Lennon on orders from the Soviet leader Yuri Andropov) are interspersed with actors playing residents speaking Chekhovs dialogue.

title: A Coaching Trees Fruits Could Spoil
description: Charlie Weis is a compelling twist on Abraham Lincolns observation that you can fool all of the people some of the time and some of the people all of the time, but you cannot fool all of the people all of the time.

title: Contestants in the Climate Slamdown
description: Marc Roberts, my favorite environment blogtoonist (then again, thats not exactly a review considering theres only one such person, I think), has tried to capture what he foresees happening in Copenhagen in less than two weeks. Click here for the full set of panels. I particularly like the sequence below, which introduces the teams vying for victory in the halls of the Bella Center. Among them, developing countries  small but theyre plucky, and theyre fighting for their lives  and the corporate lobby team  the overwhelming favorites to win

title: Theater Listings: Nov. 27  Dec. 3
description: THEATER

title: An Isolated Family Hears Outside World Knocking
description: Home is where the heart is and sometimes the pathologies too. In Home, an art-house domestic comedy with a tragic undercurrent about a family and its idiosyncratic cohabitation, home is fun house and fortress both, a bright spot, a dark corner, a place of play, a place apart. Mostly, though, its a state of mind.

title: Obamas Uninvited Guests Prompt an Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON  The Secret Service is investigating how a couple aspiring to be reality-show celebrities managed to appear at President Obamas first state dinner without being on the guest list, provoking questions about security at the White House.

title: Macys Thanksgiving Day Parade
description: The procession made its way down Seventh Avenue rather than Broadway.

title: Increased Role for Boss Puts Target on His Back
description: DENVER  Giants tight end Kevin Boss chuckled softly as he discussed a photograph recently sent to him. It showed Boss after he caught a pass against Arizona at Giants Stadium on Oct. 25.

title: Weekend Matchups: Turducken for the College Fan
description: For some reason, a couple of pro football games on Thanksgiving Day get all the credit. Thats what people think of when they think of football and Thanksgiving. I would argue that Thanksgiving pro football is like turkey. Its good enough, but needs some accoutrement to go with it. Maybe some cranberry sauce, or at the very least some stuffing and sweet potatoes. A weekend of rivalry games like this one coming up? Thats something a little more nuanced for a more delicate and refined palate. I would argue that this weekend of college games is more like the turducken, a complex and multi-layered Russian doll of food, that never fails to surprise with its confusing flavor juxtapositions and horrific caloric implications.

title: A Tradition That Cherishes Poker, Not Pumpkin Pie
description: UNCASVILLE, Conn.  Some traditions are indelibly carved into the nations psyche, among them tucking in late each November to inadvisable amounts of mashed potatoes, turkey and pie. Then there are the traditions that spring from an indifference to all that, which is how Jennifer Bi, 41 years old, mother and manicurist, daughter of China and denizen of Flushing, Queens, found herself staring down a baccarat table in a Connecticut casino at 3 a.m. on Thanksgiving.

title: Sounds of Contentment (Words Are Optional)
description: Whenever she could, Bebel Gilberto happily left words behind as she performed at Hiro Ballroom on Wednesday night. She cruised through the verses of songs until words gave way to nonsense syllables: oohs and ahs and ba-da-das; or the onomatopoeia of Chica Chica Boom Chic, a song from Carmen Miranda; and Bim Bom, a song from her father, the bossa nova sage Joo Gilberto. Setting aside verbal messages brought her closer to the bliss her music seeks, in an imagined Brazil filled with love.

title: A Rare Chinese Look at Secret Detentions
description: BEIJING  In a rare dose of candor that contradicts past official statements, a state-run magazine has published an article that details a secret network of detention centers used to prevent aggrieved citizens from lodging complaints against the Chinese government.

title: Water on the Moon, Reality on Earth
description: To the Editor:

title: When the Wheels Come Off
description: With unemployment in the city exceeding 10 percent, the timing is perfect for one of the most wrenching films about job desperation to make the rounds in some New York theaters.

title: Fort Hood and the Questions About Terrorism
description: To the Editor:

title: Math and Science: Helping Students at Home
description: To the Editor:

title: Universal Coverage: Choosing Decency and Vibrancy
description: To the Editor:

title: Cheaper Books Come at a High Cost to Worthy Literature
description: Kathleen Caldwell is ready for the day after Thanksgiving. At her charming shop in Oaklands Montclair Village, A Great Good Place for Books, a large table is laden with a smorgasbord of hardbound tomes she thinks will be hits this season.

title: To Pay for Longer School Days, Some Parents Try Raising Money
description: After raising $35,000 for gym mats, musical instruments and other extras last year, parents at Disney II Magnet School in Chicago now face a more daunting price tag  $100,000  to keep their children in class an extra hour each day.

title: Vandalism at Food Pantry Shows Best and Worst of People
description: Being violated comes in many forms.

title: Entertainment Commission Becomes Powerful Force in the City
description: Terrance Alan has worked in construction and owned strip joints, taught handicapped children and peddled low-budget gay pornographic movies, mostly starring Terrance Alan.

title: Little Love for Turkeys
description: TURKEYS Behind the birds expanding colonization of local hills and backyards is the National Wild Turkey Federation, a powerful hunters organization. In 1973, there were just over a million turkeys in North America. Today, there are seven million.

title: Report Says Irish Bishops and Police Hid Abuse
description: LONDON  The Roman Catholic Church and the police in Ireland systematically colluded in covering up decades of child sex abuse by priests in Dublin, according to a scathing report released Thursday.

title: The Pulse
description: Alderman Seeks to Decipher Zoning

title: Live Analysis: Denver 26, Giants 6, Final
description: For those who dont have the NFL Network, Paul Myerberg (in New York) will provide live updates and analysis of the Giants-Broncos game. In the Denver and New York areas, the broadcast is available on local channels (Channel 11 in New York). Refresh your browsers.

title: Whats Your Underlying Condition?
description: Boston

title: Millions of Pounds of Dead Carp for Sale in Utah
description: DENVER  The disposal problem? Ten to 20 tons of decaying carp every day. The solution? Unresolved. But wildlife managers in Utah would love to hear from anyone who thinks big  or at least creatively  and does not mind the smell.

title: A Remote Island Seeks a Boom Without a Bust
description: CHRISTMAS ISLAND, Australia  The good times are back on Christmas Island, said Trish ODonnell, this islands sole real estate agent. Three-quarters of Australians probably didnt know Christmas Island belonged to Australia, but now its a speculators market. All thanks to the I.D.C.

title: Rootless for the Holidays
description: IN my early 20s, I worked for a tree care company as a climber and spent many happy hours pruning in upper branches. The company was often hired by homeowners to remove trees to open up a view or make way for a pool or driveway.

title: Oprah to Film at White House
description: Oprah Winfrey will film a one-hour Christmas special at the White House that will include an interview with President Barack Obama, her first with him since he took office, Ms. Winfrey announced on her blog late Wednesday. The ABC special, to run on Dec. 13 at 10 p.m., will include a sit-down with President Obama and the first lady, and feature behind-the-scenes preparations for the holidays at the White House. Ms. Winfrey had not endorsed a presidential candidate until December 2007, when she came out for Mr. Obama, a fellow Chicagoan, just weeks before the crucial presidential caucuses in neighboring Iowa, which he went on to win.

title: Tyler Perry Makes Donation
description: Tyler Perry, the director of Diary of a Mad Black Woman and several other films featuring his popular screen character Madea, has donated $1 million to the N.A.A.C.P., the largest gift to date by an individual to that civil rights organization. Mr. Perry said in a statement that he had made the gift to honor the group for its 100th anniversary this year. The donation will be paid over the next four years, the N.A.A.C.P. said.

title: CBS Takes First Place
description: On the Wednesday night before Thanksgiving, Criminal Minds and CSI: NY lifted CBS into first place as the most-watched network in prime time. According to Nielsens estimates, 13.5 million viewers tuned in at 9 p.m. for Criminal Minds, making it the nights top-rated show, while CSI: NY won the 10 p.m. hour with 12.7 million viewers, outpacing The Jay Leno Show on NBC (5.1 million) and Eastwick on ABC (3.7 million). NBC ranked second, with 7.7 million viewers from 8 to 10 for a special of The Biggest Loser. Fox was third with So You Think You Can Dance at 8 (4.9 million) and Glee at 9 (6.1 million), while ABC was fourth with Modern Family at 9 (7.1 million) and Cougar Town at 9:30 (5.5 million). CBSs comedies during the 8 p.m. hour, The New Adventures of Old Christine (7 million) and Gary Unmarried (6.8 million), fared better than ABCs sitcoms, Modern Family at 8 (5.5 million) and The Middle at 8:30 (6 million).

title: Disney Is Developing High School Musical in China
description: Disney is developing a Chinese film version of its original High School Musical television movie to be released there next summer, a Disney spokeswoman told Agence France-Presse. Disney High School Musical: China will rework parts of the story about high school students dealing with rivalry, romance and peer pressure as they try out for a school show. The new version will be set at a university, for instance, since Chinese high school students are so focused on academics that they would not have time to devote to singing and dancing, the report said. The movie has begun filming in Shanghai and stars six young actors drawn from across China.

title: Superior Donuts to Close
description: Another Broadway play lacking a big-name star is closing. Superior Donuts, a bittersweet comedy by Tracy Letts, will end its run on Jan. 3, the lead producer Jeffrey Richards said on Thursday. Starring Michael McKean and Jon Michael Hill as men who become friends while working in a Chicago doughnut shop, the play is Mr. Lettss follow-up to August: Osage County, which won a Pulitzer Prize and the Tony Award for best play and closed on Broadway in June after 648 performances. August didnt have stars, either, but its award pedigree and strong critical support helped give it life. Donuts opened on Oct. 1 and will have run about 100 performances at the Music Box Theater. Last month a revival of Brighton Beach Memoirs, also without celebrities in the cast, closed after only a week.

title: Hairspray With Handsets
description: The London production of the musical Hairspray has begun offering a hand-held wireless device that translates dialogue and lyrics into eight languages for audience members who do not speak English or are hard of hearing, Agence France-Presse reported. The battery-powered handset, called AirScript, provides real-time subtitles in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Russian, Japanese and Chinese. Cambridge Consultants, which developed the technology, said the device could raise revenue for theaters by drawing in new audience members. The company hopes to widen the use of the devices to other productions on the West End and perhaps beyond.

title: Footnotes
description: Mandy Patinkin will play Benedict in an act from Much Ado About Nothing as part of Classic Stage Companys Monday-night rehearsal series. Mr. Patinkin will perform on Dec. 7 and Dec. 14 in the program, which lets performers explore an act from a classic play. ... Julie Andrews will perform on the London stage for the first time in 30 years on May 8, according to the Web site for the O2 Arena, where the revue of musical theater standards will take place. Her singing voice was damaged during an operation 12 years ago, but her manager told The Times of London that she has been able to regain some of the notes she was once well known for. ... The opening nights of Parts 2 and 3 of Horton Footes Orphans Home Cycle at the Signature Theater have been changed because of conflicts with other openings; the changes increase the chance for prominent coverage by news outlets. The new openings are Dec. 17 for Part 2 (instead of Dec. 13, when A Little Night Music is to open) and Jan. 26 for Part 3 (instead of Jan. 24, when A View From the Bridge is to open).

title: Spare Times: For Children
description: FOR CHILDREN
